meanings.definition: To form or join a group or team
meanings.sent1: The kids squadded together to play soccer in the park.
meanings.sent2: She squadded up with her friends to work on the school project.
meanings.sent3: The animals squadded up to protect themselves from the storm.
meanings.sent4: The students squadded around the teacher to hear the exciting news.
meanings.sent5: The superheroes squadded up to fight against the evil villain.

meanings.sent1: After the game, the coach praised the winning squadded.
meanings.sent2: The squadded marched in perfect formation during the parade.
meanings.sent3: The group of squadded looked impressive in their matching uniforms.
meanings.sent4: The squadded stood proudly on the podium, holding their trophy.
meanings.sent5: The squadded worked together seamlessly to complete the mission.
